Jay Liu, Diploma in Accountancy  at KHEALevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Emergency fund is a pool of money ready to be used at any mishaps/emergency e.g. Hospital bills, money used after retrenchment. Build a emergency fund first. Then head towards building your retirement fund. 0 comments2

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Emergency fund can be 6-12 months of your expenses. So if you aim for 6 months your expenses is $1000 every month, your emergency fund should be $6000 which to be honest 1 year is more than enough to reach if you save most of your savings. Cant give you exact number cause i dont know your salary/expenses. After you reach your emergency fund, you can start to build your retirement fund. Then everytime your pay increase, increase your emergency fund again and then continue building retirement. If you are earning lots of money, you can also increase your emergency fund to 12 months of your expenses. It depends on your preferences.0 comments2

Loh Tat Tian, Complex Manager at Ocean Ifm Pte LtdLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Sep 2018For this question, it seems like both options cannibalize each other (one or the other), but we can look it in another way.​1) Can you get your emergency funds up first? How long do you need to? This will already give you an idea of your retirement funds (which is normally 30X more than the emergency fund, since emergency funds are typically 1 year expenses).​2) If the rate to hit your emergency fund is long, then you need to employ the strategies as listed by HC Tang. From there, then you will be able to shorten the time period to hit the emergenc funds.​3) Getting an emergency fund also means, your first pot of gold comes right after saving the emergency funds. (anything in excess can and will become your pot of gold). Let your pot of gold turn into a hen that lays golden eggs (for you to sell off and build more pots of gold).​I opt to write shorter because many answers here have covered the rest of the details.0 comments0
